page.title: 03THE RIFLE RANGE, HIGH HAM
page.content: The present range dates from 1938, although this area has been used for weapons training for much longer; indeed the Duke of Monmouth's men practised here. During World War 2 it was used by the Army & the Home Guard. It is now owned by H.M.S. Heron and used by the Navy and Marines for small arms training. The weapons used are self-loading rifles and light machine- guns. The men follow a course and are examined in weapons training,from stripping, cleaning and care of arms, to firing at man-shaped targets. The range is a fixed line gallery range, not a tactical one. There is a public right of way over the range following a designated footpath, except when red flags are flying, signalling that the range is in use and public access is denied. The range is used almost daily, mainly from May to July.
